name: nascent-enhancer-activity
title: Enhancer Activity Profiling (eRNA Detection)
description: Identify active enhancers through enhancer RNA (eRNA) detection using nascent transcription assays. Maps functional regulatory elements genome-wide. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
Enhancer Activity via eRNA Detection

Active enhancers produce enhancer RNAs (eRNAs) that are unstable and bidirectional. Nascent RNA capture is the gold standard for detecting eRNA production and mapping functional enhancers.

Why eRNAs as Enhancer Markers?

  • Direct Activity Measure: eRNA production = active transcription at enhancer
  • Functional Enhancers: Distinguishes active from poised/inactive enhancers
  • Cell-Type Specific: Reveals context-dependent enhancer usage
  • Dynamic: Reflects real-time regulatory state
  • Unstable: Only detectable with nascent RNA methods

Enhancer Biology

eRNA Characteristics:

  • Bidirectional transcription
  • Short, unstable transcripts
  • Correlate with enhancer-promoter looping
  • Produced by RNA Pol II
  • Mark active, not poised enhancers

Scientific Applications

  • Regulatory Element Mapping: Genome-wide enhancer annotation
  • Disease Mechanisms: GWAS variants in active enhancers
  • Transcription Factor Binding: Enhancer activation by TFs
  • Developmental Programs: Stage-specific enhancer usage
  • Cancer Enhancers: Super-enhancers driving oncogenes
  • Drug Target Discovery: Druggable enhancers

Pipeline Features

  • Bidirectional Detection: Identify paired eRNA transcripts
  • Enhancer Calling: Define enhancer boundaries
  • Activity Quantification: eRNA levels as activity proxy
  • Differential Activity: Compare enhancer usage across conditions
  • Integration: Combine with ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with PRO-seq or GRO-seq data (best for eRNA detection).

Key Outputs

  • Enhancer Annotations: Genome-wide active enhancers
  • eRNA Expression: Activity levels per enhancer
  • Bidirectional Sites: Characteristic eRNA patterns
  • Differential Enhancers: Condition-specific activity

Perfect for: Regulatory genomics • Enhancer discovery • GWAS follow-up • Super-enhancers • TF target identification
